tree

Class Tree<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.Tree<V>

  • public class Tree<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to implement an abstract data type for general trees.
    Author:
    Mark Mercurio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new Tree with the specified value and children

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares the specified Object with this node for equality. Returns true if the specified Object is a Tree, has the same value as this Tree, and each child of the specified Tree equals the children of this Tree.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the Object equals this tree.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Tree. The string representation this Tree consists of this Tree's value, and each of the String representations of this Tree's children on new lines and indented two spaces.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String representation.
